Leadership is not a title, it is an ACTION. To act in favor of those in his charge has been the force driving John Addison since his early days with Primerica and just as much today. John is known globally as a master navigator of the often turbulent seas of business. Today, he loves to help companies set goals, maintain focus, and achieve the results they desire.

Leadership is a VERB.

Leadership to most people looks like a new management related job title, a few new initials behind their name, or a position at the top of the company where they get to call all of the shots. However, leadership is much more than the title you’re given; it’s the action you take and the action you encourage and create.

A good leader sets expectations for their team to show up, reach goals, be efficient, and make the moves that benefit the business. Great leaders take those expectations one step further, encouraging honesty, helpfulness, servitude, and forward-thinking, the stepping stones to success that makes a lasting impact.

N

Know Your Team.

Your team can only be moved if you know how to encourage them. It isn’t always easy to see the intricacies of people or how they interact with one another. However, knowing your team inside and out should be commonplace in leadership. Learn how to get to know your team with Addison Leadership Group.

N

Know Yourself.

To help a team understand what will work for them, a leader must first know themselves. This takes introspection and a true comfort in reflection, both skills that must be refined over time. Knowing how to use strength and be honest about weakness helps a leader navigate the intricacies of a team as well as life. Learn how Addison Leadership Group can assist your own personal growth. .

Decisions Start with Directions.

We all need guidance in life at some point or another. When the world is always so new and fresh, there will always be much left to understand. John Addison takes an approach that answers can only be found when things are examined.

Whether it be situations, relationships, or understanding as a whole, to know, one must dedicate themselves to lifelong learning, lifelong listening, and a lifetime commitment to growth.
